channel.title: Random Item
channel.description: How do i make it so if you click on a chest, it gives you one of the 4 items randomly...

item.title: Random Item
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Re-read my post, change:

public int itemsToRecieve = {4708, 4710, 4712, 4714, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 473 2, 4734, 4736, 4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722};
To:

public int[] itemsToRecieve = {4708, 4710, 4712, 4714, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 473 2, 4734, 4736, 4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722};

item.title: Random Item
item.dc:creator: @maxxy2 maxxy2
item.description:
@maxxy2 wrote:

compile error??

client.java:8: illegal initializer for int public int itemsToRecieve = {4708, 4710, 4712, 4714, 4724, 4726, 4728, 4730, 473 2, 4734, 4736, 4738, 4745, 4747, 4749, 4751, 4753, 4755, 4757, 4759, 4716, 4718, 4720, 4722}; // The items you will get from the chest. ^ client.java:10: int cannot be dereferenced return itemsToRecieve[(int) (Math.random() * itemsToRecieve.length)]; ^ client.java:10: array required, but int found return itemsToRecieve[(int) (Math.random() * itemsToRecieve.length)]; ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 3 errors Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Random Item
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Try something like this, not quite sure though:

public int randomItem() { return itemsToRecieve[(int) (Math.random() * itemsToRecieve.length)]; } public int[] itemsToRecieve = { 4151, 1038, 1050, 7462 }; // The items you will get from the chest.
Then in the first click object method/packet add:

addItem(randomItem(), [amount]);

I’m not sure as I’ve never personally used something like this, but in theory it should work.
EDIT: My mistake, make sure the integer itemsToReieve is an array. Edited in the post.

Read full topic

item.title: Random Item
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

Make a string for the random item in your player.java

public void yadda yadda();
{123, 124, 125, 126};

Than make a case for clicking the chest, and add

yadda yadda(), 1

Don’t take me head on for that. That’s an example.

Read full topic
